conclusion: Analyze the scenario step by step to answer the question.

Objects C, D, E, and F are on a different surface covered with a patterned cloth.
Objects A and B are moved through the air towards the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
Due to gravity, objects A and B will be pulled downward as they move through the air.
When objects A and B are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, they will come into contact with these objects.
Objects C, D, E, and F might be displaced or moved slightly depending on the weight and size of objects A and B.
If there is space, objects A and B might stack on top of objects C, D, E, and F.
There could be a minor impact or noise due to the contact, depending on the materials of the objects.
Objects A and B will rest on the surface where objects C, D, E, and F are located, either on top of them or next to them, depending on the available space and the nature of the objects.

Final answer: When objects A and B are moved through the air and placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, they will come into contact with these objects due to gravity.
